$SLSSimple logic: GPS patients have benefitted from extended survival in all previous 9 trials, in all 9, w/ relapse prevention and increased survival correlated to immune response.  
- Consider the Regal update data: all pooled OS of 16 months, all pooled = control + Gps is 16 months  
- vs the 21 month statistically significant Gps patient OS in the Phase 2  
- P value of .0175, ie a 98% reproducibility factor. 
- In other words Gps patients will achieve an OS of about 21 months in 98 of every 100 trials. 
-- We know from the Regal update, all pooled os is 16, including Gps and control patients.  
-- We also know there are 7 trials with CR2 patients having an OS of l.e.s.s. than 8 months - 7 published trials, with control os less than 8. 
-- We also know Dr's treating approx. 15% of the actual P3 trial patients have stated, on the record, 'os for control is extremely poor, on the order of 5-7 months", "just 6 months". 
 
Dr Tsirigotis went so far as to say, he strongly believes Gps will be approved....reddit.com/r/sellaslifescie...

$SLSI really do appreciate all the optimism around SLS science. And I own some stock and hope you're right. But as a realist who has been here for years and someone who knows not to trust the CEO at all -from experience- It concerns and upsets me that all the science and new posters just ignore SLS financial position and likelihood for massive- near term dilution AGAIN. For you newbies- - CEO  recently diluted and issued a huge amount of shares and warrants around .78/share after failing to receive a promised 3D $13mm payment. CEO lied and blamed supply chains for non-payment. 
 
In biotech- CASH is king and SLS doesn't have any. Unfortunately- they do have slimy Investment banks-always happy to facilitate dilution whenever CEO picks up the phone for $. Hence the current 7.5mm share short position planning to cover on offering. 
.  
Ok- now the fun part--- watch posters block me- defame me etc. but never provide a business response to my assertions . Sorry-but CEO is not a good guy.

$SLSWith GPS and SLS009's most advanced trial programs both centering around AML, specifically AML patients in CR1/CR2 and Relapsed/Refractory patients (nb. respectively) here's a reminder on the patient landscape for these clinical settings: 
 
Globally, 77,000 people are diagnosed each year with AML.  
 
~50-55% of patients will achieve a first clinical remission from their cancer and enter the 'CR1' maintenance setting. ~12-15% of patients will achieve a second clinical remission and enter the 'CR2' maintenance setting. CR2 is the subject of the Phase 3 REGAL trial for GPS and the company has previously generated effective data in the CR1 treatment setting. The company has stated that the FDA indicated they'd likely expand a BLA approval from CR2 into CR1 if the REGAL PH.3 trial proves a success, as CR2 patients are more infirm than CR1 and the drug's benefits translate to CR1. 
 
SLS009 is focusing on patients with the ASXL1 mutation which is expressed by ~20% of total AML patients.

$SLSShareholders meeting June 20th.  Regal was imminent  since 4Q '23/ 1Q '24.  I am hoping for a major news event on June 19th or 20th pre-market.  We know we will get an IDMC update in the next two weeks and most like an SLS009 update forecasted for 1H '24. The count down starts now, T minus 13 days till the shareholders call.Bullish

Bullish signals: Rising triangle nearing the end of its squeeze, RSI is middling, MACD just crossed over.l on a declining volume profile. Heavy SI, high CTB with a low rebate. Float seems to be pretty locked down. 

Tomorrowâ€™s price action may signal retracement to the bottom trend line, where it may breakthrough or bounce. However, Iâ€™m anticipating a small move higher as it needs to finish filling that gap. 

This is absent any catalyst. TA goes out the window if we get a news drop.Bullish

$SLSInterim Analysis from PH.3 trial active >40mos. expected very soon. Perhaps even this month, as the trial's data cmte. announced an impromptu meeting for June following scheduled meeting in late April. Reminder of historical data for their drug in trial: 
 
Ph.2 AML CR2: 21.0mos. v. 5.4mos. (control) 
 
Ph.2 AML CR1: Overall Survival rate of 47.4% at 3 yrs. post-GPS treatment v. historical published data of 20% - 25% by 2.4- to 1.9-fold, respectively. Patients receiving GPS over 60y.o. median OS of 35.3 mos. v. historical data's median OS ranging from 9.5 to 16.8 months (nb. from initial diagnosis),  a 2.25- to 3.75-fold improvement in OS associated with GPS therapy in the CR1 maintenance setting.  
 
GPS targets WT1 antigen, the#1oncogenetic target according to the Natl. Cancer Inst. It expresses in 97% of AML cases and this antigen target does not express in a meaningful qty. in healthy adult organs/tissue. GPS has demonstrated a 'very low' toxicity burden.$XBI$ABBV$MRK$BMY
